content.title: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities by Establishing Piggery, Sheep and Goat Units (General) under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana
content.department: Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana
content.details: The scheme is implemented to provide employment opportunities to unemployed residents of Haryana by helping them establish piggery, sheep, and goat units. Under this scheme, an unemployed resident of Haryana who is between 18 and 60 years of age can avail a 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock, provided they have taken a loan for establishing a 10+1 Piggery unit or a 15+1 Sheep/Goat unit.
benefits: 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing a 10+1 Piggery unit, with a maximum amount of ₹25,000/-.
25% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing a 15+1 Sheep/Goat unit, with a maximum amount of ₹24,500/-.
Insurance assistance as per the available departmental scheme.
eligibility: The applicant should be 18 to 60 years of age and a resident of Haryana.
There would be no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.
The applicant should have a space/shed for keeping animals.
The applicant would have to submit a Self-Declaration for being unemployed and for undertaking to abide by other conditions as required under the Scheme.
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme, as the Scheme is individual beneficiary-oriented.
content.application_process: Offline and Online - via CSCs. Applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district to collect the application form, fill it out, attach all relevant documents, and submit it to the concerned official.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque
Proof of availability of shed/space for keeping animals

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide employment opportunities to unemployed residents of Haryana by helping them establish piggery, sheep, and goat units.

faqs.question: What are the age criteria for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be between 18 and 60 years of age.

faqs.question: Can individuals from other states apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only residents of Haryana are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there a subsidy provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock is provided, with specific financial limits.

faqs.question: How much subsidy can one get for establishing a 10+1 piggery unit?
faqs.answer: A maximum of ₹25,000 as financial assistance in the form of subsidy.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is available for establishing a 15+1 sheep/goat unit?
faqs.answer: A maximum of ₹24,500 as financial assistance in the form of subsidy.

faqs.question: Is insurance assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, insurance assistance is provided as per the available departmental scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications required for applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.

faqs.question: Can groups or organizations apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for individual beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Do applicants need to have a specific space for keeping the animals?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must have space or a shed for keeping the animals.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail the benefits of the scheme, applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district and collect the application form.
